channel.title: gganimate on Michael Lee
channel.description: Recent content in gganimate on Michael Lee

item.title: Line Chart - College Enrollment Rate
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation Linked here: NEW STAT: The immediate college enrollment rate for #Hispanic students was higher in 2017 (67%) than in 2000 (49%). Discover more #EdStats in our 2019 #ConditionOfEd report: https://t.co/r8gJkRDeK3 #HispanicEd pic.twitter.com/amnDqvH8UH — NCES (@EdNCES) May 22, 2019 Full image: The immediate college enrollment rate for #Hispanic students was higher in 2017 (67%) than in 2000 (49%). Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Line Chart - Percentage of Students Reporting Being Bullied
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation Linked here: NEW STAT: In 2017, 20% of students ages 12-18 reported being bullied at school during the school year, representing an overall decrease from 29% in 2005. More #EdSafetyStats in the Indicators of School Crime and Safety report, available now: https://t.co/Z4JLYLn5O8 @BJSgov pic.twitter.com/l7b3XH3kd2 — NCES (@EdNCES) April 19, 2019 Full image: Between 2005 and 2017, the percentage of students ages 12-18 who reported being bullied at school decreased from 29 to 20 percent

item.title: Line Chart - On Campus Crimes
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: In 2016, about 28,400 criminal incidents on #postsec institution campuses were reported to police/ security agencies, representing a 3% increase from 2015. Learn more #CampusCrime statistics in our NEW release: https://t.co/Wvco6IxkcC pic.twitter.com/HKxgHq8gAs — NCES (@EdNCES) April 17, 2019 Full image: Between 2001 and 2016, the total number of on-campus crimes reported at postsecondary institutions decreased by 32% Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Line Chart - Status Dropout Rate
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation linked here: DYK? The #Hispanic status high school dropout rate ↓ from 27.8% to 8.6% between 2000 & 2016. What were the rates for Black & White students? Discover more: https://t.co/5SyF2HuBcJ #HispanicEd pic.twitter.com/Mg9MEzTeel — NCES (@EdNCES) February 22, 2019 Full image: Status dropout rates of 16 to 24 year olds, by race/ethnicity: 2000 through 2016 Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: State Map - Adjusted Cohort Graduation Rate
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation linked here: How have state-level adjusted cohort #graduation rates (ACGR) for public high school students changed between 2010–11 and 2016–17? Find out: https://t.co/fVvgrQbVcx pic.twitter.com/WBvUcO5r8k — NCES (@EdNCES) January 24, 2019 Full image: Adjusted cohort graduation rate (ACGR) of public high school students, by state: 2010-11 through 2016-17 Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Line Chart - Status Completion Rate
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation seen here: JUST RELEASED! Explore our new report to learn about #HighSchool status completion rates of 18-to 24-yr-olds by race/ethnicity over the past 40 years! Find more #EdTrends here: https://t.co/OkOs6B7tnC pic.twitter.com/m2U9FvIW1c — NCES (@EdNCES) December 12, 2018 Full image: Status completion rates of 18 to 24 year olds, by race/ethnicity: October 1976 through 2016 Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Average cumulative student loan balance for doctorate degree completers, by degree program: Selected years, 2000–2016
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation seen here: Between 1999–2000 & 2015–16, avg. #StudentLoan debt for medical doctorate completers increased by 97% (from $124,700 to $246,000). More #stats on student #debt here in our NEW blog: https://t.co/mz1F3aI943 pic.twitter.com/93mzhYkwgF — NCES (@EdNCES) August 18, 2018 Full image: Average cumulative student loan balance for doctorate degree completers, by degree program: Selected years, 2000–2016 Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Average cumulative student loan balance for master's degree completers, by degree program: Selected years, 2000–2016
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation seen here: DYK? Avg. #StudentLoan balances were higher in 2015–16 than in 1999–2000 for all master’s degree fields. Interested in #StudentDebt stats? Find more #EdData in our NEW BLOG: https://t.co/mz1F3aI943 pic.twitter.com/84BvN3bqWX — NCES (@EdNCES) August 7, 2018 Full image: Average cumulative student loan balance for master’s degree completers, by degree program: Selected years, 2000–2016 Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Average cumulative student loan balance for graduate school completers, by degree type: Selected years, 2000-2016
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation seen here: Among grad school completers in 2015–16 who took out #studentloans, the avg. balance was highest for those completing a professional doctorate ($186,600). Learn more in our NEW #COE2018 Spotlight: https://t.co/Yr9DzkGYMS pic.twitter.com/o7AvnRRjcH — NCES (@EdNCES) May 23, 2018 Full image: Average cumulative student loan balance for graduate school completers, by degree type: Selected years, 2000-2016 Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Percentage of revenue for elementary and secondary public schools
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation seen here: NEW Finding: Federal sources accounted for approx. 9% of the total funding for #K12 public schools in both 2005–06 and 2014 –15. https://t.co/G16loc8pyW #Education pic.twitter.com/CFuRjcqMIS — NCES (@EdNCES) February 12, 2018 Full image: Percentage of revenue for elementary and secondary public schools Interested in learning more? Hire me to consult on your next project, follow me on twitter, leave a comment, or contact me via email.

item.title: Highest and lowest spending states per public education pupil
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Animation seen here: DYK? Current expenditures per pupil ranged from $6,751 in Utah to $20,744 in New York for FY 2015: https://t.co/FDcsYpjmcj #Finance #Education pic.twitter.com/r5kUgNE4vF — NCES (@EdNCES) January 26, 2018 Full image: Current Expenditures per pupil in the lowest and highest spending states Interested in learning more? New from #COE2017: 21% of students reported being bullied at school in 2015, a ↓ from the 28% reported in 2005. https://t.co/5BlyLdHS9W pic.twitter.com/Fr1pTt8xca — NCES (@EdNCES) May 3, 2017 Full image: COE 2017 Bullying Line Graph Animation Interested in learning more? item.title: Reproducing the WSJ Measles Vaccination Chart Using R
item.author: mdlee12@gmail.com (Michael Lee)
item.description: Mastering Animation in R UPDATE: In order to reproduce some portions of this code you need the gganimate package using the deprecated API. To access that version, download v0.1.1 here. Recently I’ve been working on creating gif animations for social media: New from #COE2017: 21% of students reported being bullied at school in 2015, a ↓ from the 28% reported in 2005. https://t.co/5BlyLdHS9W pic.twitter.com/Fr1pTt8xca — NCES (@EdNCES) May 3, 2017 It’s pretty addicting!
